response.answer_text: Surveillance: to observe Footage: old term in reference to film archives, the correct term should be “coverage” In general, surveillance coverage is the data from video cameras that has been retained for future reference. Anything from a snippet (still-frame) to full-event coverage will allow an investigation, to either prove or dis-prove, that an event transpired. Always review any possible coverage available during an investigation, you just never know what you may see!

closed-circuit TV (CCTV), otherwise called video surveillance, is the utilization of camcorders to transmit a sign to a particular spot, on a restricted arrangement of screens. ... Observation of the open utilizing CCTV is normal in numerous territories around the globe.
